Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Boards.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
Represents the main game board managing the players, positions, tiles, and gameplay mechanics.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(TileSets list, int lv, CardStacks stack)
      Constructs a GameBoard instance with the specified tile sets, game level, and card stacks. This class initializes the game board, including positions, start positions, and related game elements.
      Parameters:
      list - the set of tiles to be used in the game
      lv - the level of the game, determines board configuration
      stack - the stack of cards to be used within the game

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player NewPlayer)
      adds a new player to the game
      Parameters:
      NewPlayer - reference to the newborn player

    • callHourglass

      public void callHourglass(Player player) throws RuntimeException
      Invokes the hourglass functionality for the specified player. Throws a RuntimeException if the hourglass can only be used once and the player has not prepared their ship.
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to use the hourglass
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the player's ship is not ready or if an error occurs during the hourglass operation

    • StartHourglass

      public void StartHourglass() throws RuntimeException
      Starts the hourglass timer within the game board. This method validates the current game state and manages the hourglass lifecycle. This method performs the following validations: 1. Ensures that the hourglass cannot be started in a level 1 game. 2. Ensures that the hourglass is not already running before attempting to start it. 3. Ensures that there are remaining usages available for the hourglass. If all validations pass, the hourglass is locked (preventing concurrent starts) and then started, decrementing its remaining usages after completion.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game is in level 1 or the hourglass is already running.
      RuntimeException - if the hourglass has no remaining usages left.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Player DeadMan)
      Removes a specified player from the game. The method identifies the player within the list of active players and removes the corresponding entry.
      Parameters:
      DeadMan - the player to be removed from the game
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the specified player is not found in the current list of players

    • SetStartingPosition

      public void SetStartingPosition(Player pl)
      sets the starting position of a player on the common board: the position players[0] corresponds to the starting position of the 1st player the leader (1st player) will be in the first position of the arraylist
      Parameters:
      pl - reference to the player

    • SetStartingPosition

      public void SetStartingPosition(Player pl, int index) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the starting position of a player on the game board. If the specified position is already taken or the player is already on the board, an exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      pl - the player for whom the starting position is being set
      index - the index of the starting position to assign
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified index is out of bounds or if the position is already occupied
      IllegalStateException - if the player is already positioned on the board

    • removePlayerAndShift

      public void removePlayerAndShift(Player pl) throws RuntimeException
      Removes a specified player from the game and shifts the positions of the remaining players on the game board accordingly. This method ensures the player's position is cleared, updates other players' positions, and decrements the count of players on the board. Updates are sent to notify relevant components of these changes.
      Parameters:
      pl - the player to be removed and whose position will be cleared on the game board
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the player removal process

    • updateAllPosition

      public void updateAllPosition()
      Updates the positions of all players on the game board and sends relevant updates. This method iterates through a collection of player-position pairs. For each player, if the associated position is non-negative, a game board event is generated and sent via the `sendUpdates` method. The event contains the player's current position and ID. This ensures that the game board state is updated and communicated to all registered listeners. Preconditions: - `players` is a collection of `Player_IntegerPair` objects, where each pair represents a player and their corresponding score on the game board. Behavior: - Iterates through `players`. - If a player's score is greater than or equal to 0, an update is sent via the `sendUpdates` method. Dependencies: - Rel

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(String ID, int nSteps) throws IllegalArgumentException
      moves the player forward or backwards on the board of a selected number of steps
      Parameters:
      ID - of the player to move
      nSteps - to run (negative if the player is moving backwards)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of steps is 0

    • checkDoubleLap

      public ArrayList<Player> checkDoubleLap()
      Checks and returns a list of players who have completed or exceeded a double lap based on their positions relative to other players on the game board. Iterates through all players and evaluates if their current position meets the condition for completing a double lap relative to other players. A player is considered to have completed a double lap if the difference in position between them and another player is greater than or equal to the configured threshold (nPositions). Ensures that the same player is not added multiple times to the result list.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of players who have completed or exceeded a double lap.

    • NewCard

      public Card NewCard()
      Picks and sets a new card as the current card in the game. This method retrieves a new card from the card stack and assigns it to the current card in the game board. It also updates each player by setting the newly picked card to their state and associates the card with the game board. A message is printed showing the card's ID and class type.
      Returns:
      the newly selected card from the card stack

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Retrieves a copy of the list of players currently participating in the game. This method iterates through the internal collection of Player_IntegerPair objects, extracts each Player, and adds them to a new list.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing a copy of all players in the game.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Retrieves the current level of the game.
      Returns:
      the game level as an integer

    • getPositions

      public Player[] getPositions()
      Retrieves the current positions of players on the game board.
      Returns:
      an array of Player objects representing the positions of all players on the board.

    • getTilesSets

      public TileSets getTilesSets()
      Retrieves the tile sets associated with the game board.
      Returns:
      the TileSets object representing the tiles used in the game.

    • getCardStack

      public CardStacks getCardStack()
      Retrieves the card stack currently being used in the game board.
      Returns:
      the CardStacks instance representing the deck of cards associated with the game.

    • getHourglass

      public Hourglass getHourglass()
      Retrieves the hourglass associated with the game board.
      Returns:
      the instance of Hourglass currently used in the game.

    • abandonRace

      public void abandonRace(Player loser, String message, boolean started)
      Handles the process of a player abandoning an ongoing or unstarted race. It removes the player from the race board, records their final score if applicable, and triggers their race completion process with a corresponding message.
      Parameters:
      loser - The player who is abandoning the race.
      message - The message indicating the reason or context of abandonment.
      started - A boolean indicating whether the race had already started.

    • finishGame

      public void finishGame()
      Concludes the game by calculating final scores for each player, updating the scoreboard, and notifying each player about their final outcome. The method performs the following steps: 1. Iterates through the list of players to calculate their final scores using their respective `CalculateResult` method and updates the scoreboard. 2. Processes each player's finishing position in the game and clears their position in the game state. 3. Constructs a `ScoreboardEvent` using the updated scoreboard and calls the `finishRace` method for each player, passing their final results, outcome, and event details. 4. Clears the list of players to finalize the game state.

    • arrivalBonus

      public int arrivalBonus(Player player)
      Calculates the arrival bonus for a player based on their position in the player list and the current level of the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the arrival bonus is calculated.
      Returns:
      The arrival bonus for the specified player.

    • beautyBonus

      public int beautyBonus(Player player)
      Calculates the beauty bonus for a specified player based on their performance compared to other players in terms of exposed connectors on their player board.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the beauty bonus is calculated.
      Returns:
      The beauty bonus value. If the specified player has the fewest exposed connectors, it returns double the level of the current context; otherwise, it returns 0.

    • sendUpdates

      public void sendUpdates(GameBoardEvent event)
      Sends updates to all registered listeners when a GameBoardEvent occurs.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that contains information about the change in the game board

    • setListeners

      public void setListeners(GameBoardListener listener)
      Adds a GameBoardListener to the list of listeners.
      Parameters:
      listener - the GameBoardListener to be added

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(GameBoardListener listener)
      Removes the specified listener from the collection of listeners that are notified of changes to the game board.
      Parameters:
      listener - the GameBoardListener to be removed
